org.mitre.provenance.surrogate.sgf

Class SurgicalSGF

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.surrogate.SurrogateGeneratingFunction
      • org.mitre.provenance.surrogate.sgf.SurgicalSGF
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SurgicalHideAll, SurgicalHideFirst, SurgicalInferAll, SurgicalInferFirst

    public abstract class SurgicalSGF
extends SurrogateGeneratingFunction
    A surgical SGF is one that can be applied to many objects, and that will only take "surgical action" on those objects that match by name. So the SGF can be applied as a matter of policy to all objects, but it will only act in certain tunable circumstances.
    Author:
    DMALLEN

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String MARKER 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SurgicalSGF(String marker)
      Create a new surgical SGF with a given marker; the only objects that surrogates will be generated for are those whose name contains the marker.

      • generateSurrogate

        public PLUSObject generateSurrogate(PLUSObject object,
                                    User user)
        Description copied from class: SurrogateGeneratingFunction
        This function will do nothing but throw an exception. Please subclass it!

        All Surrogate Generating Functions (SGFs) take two arguments - the object for which they will generate a surrogate, and the user who is requesting access to the data. The object itself will always contain the underlying full-access data, equivalent to what is visible to the data owner, or the super-user.

        The surrogate generating function takes the information about the user and uses it to compute and return a suitable surrogate for that user. PLUS guarantees that the surrogate will be shown to that user, but no other user with privileges dominated by this user's privileges.

        Note that in the return PLUSObject value, you must use the setSurrogateDetail method. Objects that come back without surrogate details will not be considered valid.

        Overrides:
        generateSurrogate in class SurrogateGeneratingFunction
        Parameters:
        object - the object for which a surrogate is needed.
        user - the user who is requesting the object.
        Returns:
        a PLUSObject corresponding to the surrogate, with surrogate detail information present.
        See Also:
        Surrogateable.setSurrogateDetail(SurrogateDetail)
